column4: I've downloaded all updates. but i still isnt recognising my gfx card, anyone any ideas?
I've downloaded all updates. but i still isnt recognising my gfx card, anyone any ideas?

Can anyone help me, i have an MSI Geforce 8400GS graphics card, i get display and everything but it wont lemme use desktop effects for high resolutions, can anyone think of a reason for this? it doesn't appear in my restricted drivers either
damit
try glxinfo... if the 2 providers listed don't say nvidia, there ya go.
http://liinux.hfds.com/files/n-i.txt
install the nvidia binary via the nvidia-installer
where do i get this installer
read my link i posted above
/lastlog jetscreamer
assuming you downloaded the proper file that supports your gpu (aka the latest) and add sudo to whatever, and have all the other unmentioned requirements to compile stuff, yes
you have to read the whole thing and follow the directions
you have to download the file. you have to change things in the command if you need to. you need to add sudo.
can i private you please?
not atm, after i get off work maybe i can help you figure it out more
you said you had an 8400gt? just get the latest version, .09 . or you can just get the .07 if you really want.
any 8xxx, get the latest.. iirc it's the 169.09
did you read what it said?
just go to nvidia.com and d/l the latest linux version
then just change the .07 to .09 in the command, and add sudo in front of the apt-get and the sh NVIDIA
or just split the command line into it's two seperate command..  either side of the &&
